actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

actions.committee: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to provide for an application process for interested parties to apply for a county to be designated as a rural area, and for other purposes.

summary.text:
Helping Expand Lending Practices in Rural Communities Act of 2014 or the HELP Rural Communities Act of 2014 - Amends the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to direct the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) to establish an application process under which a person who lives or does business in a state may apply to have a county designated as a rural area for purposes of a federal consumer financial law.

Prescribes criteria for the CFPB to consider when evaluating such an application.

Requires the CFPB to enter each such application into a sortable, downloadable database publicly accessible through its website.

titles.title: Helping Expand Lending Practices in Rural Communities Act of 2014

A bill to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to provide for an application process for interested parties to apply for a county to be designated as a rural area, and for other purposes.
